node.text: Thanks to the filibuster, 41 Senate Republicans representing just 21% of the country are blocking laws supported by the vast majority of Americans. That’s not just wrong – it’s unconstitutional.

node.text: All the benefits of growth and technological change could only benefit those at the top — unless American workers have a voice.

node.title: Will Technology Help the Working Class?

node.text: Can I let you in on a secret? Billionaire philanthropy isn’t charity. It’s PR to cover up exploitative business practices and shield their wealth.

node.text: Ever notice how nobody asks “how are you going to pay for it” when we give massive government subsidies to Big Pharma, Big Oil, Big Tech, and defense contractors? We have socialism for the super-rich, merciless capitalism for the rest.

node.title: The Real Socialism in America is Not What You Think

node.text:
The U.S. welcomed nearly 130,000 Vietnamese refugees in April, 1975 following the Vietnam War. Now, following our disastrous 20 year war in Afghanistan, we have a moral obligation to welcome as many Afghan refugees as possible.

Call your reps: (202) 224-3121

Call script and other numbers to call at the linktree in my bio.

node.text: The media’s obsession with “balanced coverage” is nonsense. There is no middle ground between democracy and fascism.

node.title: The Media Bias Nobody is Talking About

node.text:
Millennials own less than 5% of all US wealth. In 1989, when baby boomers were the same age, they controlled 21% of the nation's wealth.

Young people are not lazy. The economy is rigged against them.

node.title: How the System is Failing Young People

node.text: Why aren’t Biden and the Dems doing everything in their power to protect voting rights? Is it just Manchin and Sinema? Or does the reason go deeper: because the moneyed interests who bankroll Democratic candidates are terrified of democracy?

node.title: The Oligarchy is Terrified of Democracy

node.text:
In 1916, Sears launched a program to share stock with its workers. By the 1950s, Sears workers had accumulated enough stock that they owned a quarter of the company. 

Who else thinks we should bring back profit-sharing?

node.text:
Frito-Lay workers are on strike in Kansas. Coal miners are on strike in Alabama. Rideshare drivers are on strike across the country.

Make no mistake: Workers are taking their power back.

node.title: Imagine a World Where Workers Have Power

node.text:
The next time someone claims billionaires rocketing off to space is a sign of societal progress and heroism, remind them that there are basically 4 ways to accumulate a billion dollars in America: 1) Profiting from a monopoly; 2) Insider trading; 3) Political payoffs; 4) Inheritance

None of these has anything to do with being successful in the supposed free market.

node.text: There are a lot of things to worry about right now, like climate change, voting rights, and worker exploitation. Here’s why inflation isn’t one of them, despite what conservatives and corporations would like you to believe.

node.title: Don’t Buy Into the Inflation Scare

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich In Finland, they have an average of 161 weeks of paid family leave. In Hungary, it's 160 weeks. In Norway, it's 91 weeks. In Korea, it's 64 weeks. In Germany, it's 58 weeks. In Sweden, it's 55 weeks. In Canada, it's 51 weeks. In the United States, it's O. O weeks.'.

node.text: Is this what they mean by American exceptionalism?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Bombshell report from the US Treasury this week: The richest 1% of Americans aren't paying $163,000,000,000 they owe in taxes each year. (Most other Americans are paying what they owe.)'.

node.text: Quite literally, tax the rich.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Bombshell report from the US Treasury this week: The richest 1% of Americans aren't paying $163,000,000,000 they owe in taxes each year. (Most other Americans are paying what they owe.)'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich The IRS must have the funds to beef up enforcement and help fund the Democrats' game-changing investment in the American people. Every additional $1 of IRS funding yields $3 of tax revenue, mostly from the very rich who illegally avoid paying taxes owed.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 10, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich I have this radical, efty opinion that we shouldn't allow the richest 1 percent of Americans to evade $163,000,000,000 in taxes each year.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 09, 2021. May be an image of money and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich FYI: These seven companies have each donated over $100,000 to the cosponsors of Texas' abortion ban: -AT&T: $291,042 Cha Communications: $219,500 -Berkshire Hathaway: $128,550 -Exelon: $124,000 -UnitedHealth Group: $121,000 -Union Pacific: $109,000 -Chevo: $105,000'.

node.text: Always follow the money.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 09, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich …• Can the media stop acting like the Dems $3.5 budget package is some incomprehensible expenditure? It's $3.5T over 10 years. Meanwhile, we spend more than $700B on defense every single year. That equates to more than $7T over 10 years. Where's the media outrage over that?'.

node.text:
Ignore the bad-faith spending hawks who claim we can’t afford the Democrats’ game-changing budget resolution. We give the Pentagon $2 billion a day.

This is a once-in-a-generation opportunity to build a fairer America. Please call your senators and express your support: (202) 224-3121

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 09, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich …• Can the media stop acting like the Dems $3.5 budget package is some incomprehensible expenditure? It's $3.5T over 10 years. Meanwhile, we spend more than $700B on defense every single year. That equates to more than $7T over 10 years. Where's the media outrage over that?'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 09, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich … Last week, fourteen Democrats broke ranks to back a $24 billion increase to the $715 billion Pentagon budget. Did you notice how nobody asked "how are you going to pay for it"?'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 09, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Don't let anyone tell you we can't afford the Democrats' game-changing budget resolution. The war in Afghanistan cost $300 million per day for *20 years.*'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 09, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich This budget resolution is historic: -Universal pre-K -Free community college -Paid leave -Medicare expansion -Climate action It's going to take all of us to get it past the spending hawks in the Senate and to Biden's desk with all of its programs intact. Let's get to work.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 08, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich PSA: If you allow people to vote with a handgun permit but not a state-university issued ID, you don't actually care about "protecting elections," you care about suppressing the votes of people who disagree with you.'.

node.text: Remember, folks. If your vote didn’t matter, they wouldn’t be trying so hard to take it away.

node.text: Thanks to the filibuster, 41 Senate Republicans representing just 21% of the country are blocking laws supported by the vast majority of Americans. That’s not just wrong – it’s unconstitutional.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich 76% of California recall ballots haven't been returned. CA voters: It's essential that you vote against the recall and mai in your ballots by Sept 14. Needless to say, if Republicans take power, it would have devastating consequences for California and beyond. (..e: Texas)'.

node.text: California voters: The September 14 deadline to mail in your ballots is fast approaching. This final week is critical. Please spread the word. #votenoonrecall

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Robert Reich on September 07, 2021 tagging @bermz. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Ari Berman @AriBerman Breaking: Texas Gov Abbott has signed sweeping GOP voter suppression bill bill #SB1 In Texas you can carry a gun without a permit & citizen bounty hunters can ban abortions but you can't drop off your mail ballot or register to vote online'.

node.text: This is a four-alarm fire for our democracy. Anyone else wish Biden would make it clear that preserving voting rights is more important than preserving the filibuster?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Robert Reich on September 07, 2021 tagging @bermz. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Ari Berman @AriBerman Breaking: Texas Gov Abbott has signed sweeping GOP voter suppression bill bill #SB1 In Texas you can carry a gun without a permit & citizen bounty hunters can ban abortions but you can't drop off your mail ballot or register to vote online'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich … The nation' most egregious anti- democracy voting restrictions are now law in Texas. Meanwhile, voting rights legislation languishes in the Senate because Manchin and Sinema refuse to work around the filibuster. I am furious and you should be. too.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 07, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich You know what's more radical than abolishing the filibuster? Watching voting rights and the right to choose get eviscerated and doing absolutely nothing to stop it.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 06, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Welcome to America, where lawmakers chose to kick 9 million jobless Americans off unemployment benefits on Labor Day during a global pandemic.'.

node.text: It doesn't have to be this way.

node.text:
Happy Labor Day! Never forget that the working class outnumbers the corporate class by a massive margin. Keep the pressure on.

Solidarity with striking workers everywhere.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 05, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich It's not radical to want corporations and billionaires to pay their fair share. What's radical is for corporations and billionaires to pay nothing in taxes and call it fair.'.

node.text: It’s time for the wealthy to pay their fair share.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Reminder: If your vote didn't matter, they wouldn't be doing everything in their power to take it away.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Reminder: If your vote didn't matter, they wouldn't be doing everything in their power to take it away.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 05, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Let's get one thing straight: The changes in voting laws by Republican state legislatures aren't a response to voter fraud whic is non-existent) but to voter turnout which they want to suppress).'.
